required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Infusion of Levosimendan in Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Infusion of Levosimendan in High Risk Cardiac Surgery Patients: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this retrospective study will be to investigate the effect of the preoperative administration of levosimendan on the outcome of patients with compromised cardiac function undergoing cardiac surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with severely reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) face a high risk of morbidity and mortality after cardiac surgery. Impaired cardiac function preoperatively predisposes patients to low cardiac output syndrome. Levosimendan acts by a different mechanism than traditional inotropes and its preoperative use could improve the outcome of patients with cardiac failure. Specifically, it promotes vasodilation of coronary, pulmonary and systemic vessels, has an anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant effect and enhances cardiac contractility by improving the response of the myofilaments to intracellular calcium.
The aim of this retrospective study will be to investigate the effect of the preoperative administration of levosimendan on the outcome of patients with compromised cardiac function undergoing cardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during stay in ICU, approximately 48 hours postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: hours of mechanical ventilation during patient stay in Intensive Care Unit (ICU)

primary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperatively, from induction to end of anesthesia, an average period of 3 hours

primary_outcome.description: need for inotrope use, yes or no

primary_outcome.description: need for inotrope use, yes or no

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperatively, an average period of 7-10 days
primary_outcome.description: development of new-onset arrhythmias, yes or no

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperatively, an average period of 7-10 days
primary_outcome.description: development of new-onset renal dysfunction, defined as an increase in creatinine levels over 0.3 mg/dL from the initial values

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperatively, an average period of 7-10 days
primary_outcome.description: duration of patient stay in ICU in days

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperatively, up to 20 days after the operation
primary_outcome.description: duration of hospital stay after surgery in days

primary_outcome.measure: incidence of death within the first 30 days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: patient survival within the first 30 days after surgery, yes or no

primary_outcome.measure: need of mechanical assist devices intraoperatively

primary_outcome.description: need for mechanical assist devices, yes or no

primary_outcome.measure: need of mechanical assist devices postoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperatively, an average period of 7-10 days
primary_outcome.description: need for mechanical assist devices, yes or no

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in cardiac output (CO)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after anesthesia induction, 10 minutes after bypass discontinuation, end of operation (an average period of 3 hours after start of surgery), 12 hours after ICU admittance, 24 hours after ICU admittance,
primary_outcome.description: a Swan-Ganz catheter will be used for hemodynamic measurements

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in mean arterial pressure (MAP)

primary_outcome.description: a Swan-Ganz catheter will be used for hemodynamic measurements

primary_outcome.description: a Swan-Ganz catheter will be used for hemodynamic measurements

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in systemic vascular resistance (SVR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after anesthesia induction, 10 minutes after bypass discontinuation, end of operation (an average period of 3 hours after start of surgery), 12 hours after ICU admittance, 24 hours after ICU admittance,
primary_outcome.description: a Swan-Ganz catheter will be used for hemodynamic measurements

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients who were administered levosimendan at a dose of 0.1µg/Kg/min for 24 hours prior to surgery
patients who were not administered levosimendan prior to surgery

intervention.description: the study group will consist of patients who have received a continuous infusion of levosimendan 0.1 μg/kg/min for 24 hours before cardiac surgery
intervention.arm_group_label: patients who were administered levosimendan at a dose of 0.1µg/Kg/min for 24 hours prior to surgery

intervention.description: the control group will consist of patients who proceeded to the cardiac operation without any infusion for 24 hours preoperatively
intervention.arm_group_label: patients who were not administered levosimendan prior to surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective cardiac surgery
- cardiac surgery under cardiopulmonary bypass
- low ejection fraction (<40%)
Exclusion Criteria:
- age <18 years old
- urgent operation
- glomerular filtration rate<30 ml/min
- hepatic dysfunction preoperatively
- side effects (hypotension, tachycardia, ST segment abnormalities during levosimendan administration
- redo surgery
